definition: clean-living and honest (idiom); to avoid immorality/to shun evil influence/to mind one's own business and keep out of trouble/to keep one's hands clean
clean
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to

sentences.english: We stay out, and watch genocide engulf Rwanda.
sentences.chinese: 我們潔身自好，卻眼見種族滅絕吞沒盧旺達。

sentences.english: Also warned the public to keep his nose clean, do not participate in gambling.
sentences.chinese: 同時也告誡廣大市民要潔身自好，不要參與賭博。

sentences.english: How can I believe thtowards there is still pure love in this world?
sentences.chinese: 讓我如何自信，這世界上還有潔身自好的愛情。

sentences.english: How to avoid sexual partners, to Clean.
sentences.chinese: 避免有多個性伴侶，要潔身自好。

sentences.english: This can help a worker keep his nose clean or stay out of trouble.
sentences.chinese: 這能幫助一個工人潔身自好，遠離麻煩。

to be self-interested
to bring trouble on oneself (idiom)
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)

definition: fickle (woman)
to stay calm/to keep one's composure
scholars tend to disparage one another (idiom)
sneering/sarcasm/cynical remarks

paying more attention to a lover than friends (idiom)/to value sex over friendship

to have boundless prospects
